com.solution2013

Class Dijkstras

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solution2013.Dijkstras

  • public class Dijkstras
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses Dijkstra's pathfinding algorithm as a basis for finding an ideal path based on our current situation TODO: Detail algorithm
    Author:
    Daniel Centore

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dijkstras

        public Dijkstras(int keys,
         FieldMap map)
        Creates a new instance of the Dijkstra's algorithm. You should regenerate this every time the number of keys or the map changes However, you don't actually need to until you run out of moves on your Stack. Sometimes though with more knowledge a better decision can be made.
        Parameters:
        keys - Number of keys we have
        map - The FieldMap of the maze

    • Method Detail

      • getNext

        public java.util.Stack<SpaceWrapper> getNext()
                                      throws Dijkstras.GetKeyException
        Figures out which path to take next. This algorithm is really the "guts" of this program.
        Returns:
        A Stack which gives you the moves you should take in order. The first and last elements are where you are and where you want to be, respectively.
        Throws:
        Dijkstras.GetKeyException - If we want you to pick up a key instead of following a path

      • shortestToType

        public java.util.Stack<SpaceWrapper> shortestToType(java.awt.Point start,
                                           com.csc2013.DungeonMaze.BoxType type)

      • shortestToType

        public java.util.Stack<SpaceWrapper> shortestToType(java.awt.Point start,
                                           Space goal)

      • shortestToType

        public java.util.Stack<SpaceWrapper> shortestToType(java.awt.Point start,
                                           com.csc2013.DungeonMaze.BoxType type,
                                           Space goal)
        Finds the shortest path from a Point to a goal. The goal can be either a certain type of space (like unexplored, door, key) or to a specific space (like 2,5)
        Parameters:
        start - The starting Point
        type - The DungeonMaze.BoxType we are looking for. Set to null if you want unexplored or to use the Space goal instead.
        goal - The Space goal we want to go to. Set to null to use the DungeonMaze.BoxType goal.
        Returns:
        The Stack of moves to follow. The first element will be the Space on Point and the last element is the goal. This can be null if there is no possible path.

      • min

        private SpaceWrapper min(java.util.Collection<SpaceWrapper> collection)
        Find the element in the SpaceWrapper with the shortest length.
        Parameters:
        collection - The Collection of SpaceWrappers
        Returns:
        The SpaceWrapper with the smallest value.

      • wrap

        public java.util.HashMap<Space,SpaceWrapper> wrap(java.util.List<Space> spaces,
                                         java.awt.Point start)
        Wraps a List of Spaces in SpaceWrappers and spits them out as a HashMap where the key is the Space and the value the SpaceWrapper. This HashMap includes one Key,Value combination which are null,SpaceWrapper(space=null) to symbolize an unexplored area Sets the length of each of these to infinity (Ineteger.MAX_VALUE) except for the start node which is 0.
        Parameters:
        spaces - The List of Spaces
        start - The start node whose distance we set to 0.
        Returns:
        The HashMap of Space,SpaceWrapper
